Package io.dimeformat

Class Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dimeformat.Item
      • io.dimeformat.Key
  • public class Key
extends Item
    Represents cryptographic keys. This may be keys for signing and verifying other Di:ME items and envelopes, used for encryption purposes, or when exchanging shared keys between entities.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Key

        public Key​(java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities,
           byte[] rawKey,
           byte[] rawPub,
           java.lang.String suiteName)
        Constructor to create a key instance from raw key byte-arrays. This is intended to be used by cryptographic suite implementations to create keys from generated byte-arrays.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - The capabilities of the created key.
        rawKey - The raw secret/private key as a byte-array.
        rawPub - The raw public key as a byte-array.
        suiteName - The name of the cryptographic suite that was used to create the key.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
        Specified by:
        getHeader in class Item
        Returns:
        The item header of the DiME item.

      • getCryptoSuiteName

        public java.lang.String getCryptoSuiteName()
        Returns the cryptographic suite used to generate they key.
        Returns:
        Cryptographic suite

      • getSecret

        public java.lang.String getSecret()
        The secret part of the key. This part should never be stored or transmitted in plain text.
        Returns:
        A base 58 encoded string.

      • getPublic

        public java.lang.String getPublic()
        The public part of the key. This part may be stored or transmitted in plain text.
        Returns:
        A base 58 encoded string.

      • getKeyBytes

        public byte[] getKeyBytes​(Claim claim)
        Returns the raw byte array of the requested key. Valid claims to request are Claim.KEY and Claim.PUB.
        Parameters:
        claim - The key, expressed as a claim, to request bytes of.
        Returns:
        The raw byte array of the key, null if none exists.

      • getCapability

        public java.util.List<KeyCapability> getCapability()
        Returns a list of cryptographic capabilities that the key may perform.
        Returns:
        List of capabilities.

      • hasCapability

        public boolean hasCapability​(KeyCapability capability)
        Indicates if a key may be used for a specific cryptographic capability.
        Parameters:
        capability - The capability to test for.
        Returns:
        True if key supports the use, false otherwise.

      • generateKey

        public static Key generateKey​(java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities,
                              java.lang.String context)
        Will generate a new key for a specific cryptographic capabilities and setting a context to the key.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - The capabilities of the key.
        context - The context to attach to the key, may be null.
        Returns:
        A newly generated key.

      • generateKey

        public static Key generateKey​(java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities,
                              long validFor,
                              java.util.UUID issuerId,
                              java.lang.String context)
        Will generate a new key for a specific cryptographic capabilities, an expiration date, and the identifier of the issuer. Abiding to the expiration date is application specific as the key will continue to function after the expiration date. Providing Dime.NO_EXPIRATION as validFor will skip setting an expiration date. The specified context will be attached to the generated key.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - The capabilities of the key.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the key should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerId - The identifier of the issuer (creator) of the key, may be null.
        context - The context to attach to the key, may be null.
        Returns:
        A newly generated key.

      • generateKey

        public static Key generateKey​(java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities,
                              long validFor,
                              java.util.UUID issuerId,
                              java.lang.String context,
                              java.lang.String suiteName)
        Will generate a new key for a specific cryptographic capabilities, an expiration date, and the identifier of the issuer. Abiding to the expiration date is application specific as the key will continue to function after the expiration date. Providing Dime.NO_EXPIRATION as validFor will skip setting an expiration date. The specified context will be attached to the generated key. The cryptographic suite specified will be used when generating the key.
        Parameters:
        capabilities - The capabilities of the key.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the key should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerId - The identifier of the issuer (creator) of the key, may be null.
        context - The context to attach to the key, may be null.
        suiteName - The name of the cryptographic suite to use, if null, then the default suite will be used.
        Returns:
        A newly generated key.

      • publicCopy

        public Key publicCopy()
        Will create a copy of a key with only the public part left. This should be used when transmitting a key to another entity, when the receiving entity only needs the public part.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the key with only the public part.

      • generateSharedSecret

        public Key generateSharedSecret​(Key key,
                                java.util.List<KeyCapability> capabilities)
                         throws CryptographyException
        Generates a shared secret from the current key and another provided key. Both keys must have key usage EXCHANGE specified.
        Parameters:
        key - The other key to use with the key exchange (generation of shared key).
        capabilities - The requested capabilities of the generated shared key, usually KeyCapability.ENCRYPT.
        Returns:
        The generated shared key.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.
